metadata.case_name: Appellants v. Life Insurance Corporation of India
metadata.case_number: Civil Appeals Nos. 301 to 319 and 1105 of 1969

facts.text: Appellants filed applications against the Life Insurance Corporation of India under s. 33C(2) of the Industrial Disputes Act, 1947, for computing in terms of money the benefit of holidays and for recovering the amount.

Central Government Labour Court, Bombay, by order dated April 16, 1968, in Applications Nos. LCB-28 of 1965 etc., held that the applications were barred under art. 137 of the Limitation Act, 1963, insofar as the claim was for period beyond three years.
Labour Court followed the decision of the Full Bench of the Bombay High Court in The Manager M/s. P. K. Porwal v. The Labour Court.
Bombay High Court held that applications under s. 33C(2) prior to amendment by Central Act XXXVI of 1964 were governed by art. 137 of the Limitation Act, 1963.
No award or settlement under which the benefit of holidays had already been computed.

legal_issues.text: Whether art. 137 of the Limitation Act, 1963 applies to applications under s. 33C(2) of the Industrial Disputes Act, 1947
Whether the applications should have been filed under s. 33C(1) instead of s. 33C(2) of the Industrial Disputes Act, 1947, and whether s. 33C(2) provides for the mode of decision

petitioner_arguments.text: Applications under s. 33C(2) are not barred by art. 137 of the Limitation Act, 1963, relying on Town Municipal Council, Athani v. The Presiding Officer, Labour Court, Hubli
petitioner_arguments.legal_basis: Town Municipal Council, Athani v. The Presiding Officer, Labour Court, Hubli; Bombay Gas Co. Ltd. v. Gopal Bhiva and Others

respondent_arguments.text: Applications should have been filed under s. 33C(1) rather than s. 33C(2), and s. 33C(2) does not mention how the question is to be decided
respondent_arguments.legal_basis: s. 33C(1) and s. 33C(2) of the Industrial Disputes Act, 1947

court_reasoning.text: Art. 137 of the Limitation Act, 1963 only applies to applications to Courts; Labour Court is not a court within the Indian Limitation Act, 1963. Scheme of Limitation Act deals only with applications to courts, as seen from Third Division of Schedule, s.4 and s.5.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Labour Court is not a court

court_reasoning.text: Dissent from Bombay High Court decision; follows Town Municipal Council, Athani. Interpretation of art. 181 of 1908 Act applies to art. 137 of 1963 Act.
court_reasoning.key_observation: No drastic change intended in scope of art. 137

court_reasoning.text: S. 33C(1) deals with money due under settlement, award or Chapter VA; s. 33C(2) deals with entitlement to money or benefit capable of being computed in terms of money. Case falls under s. 33C(2). Mode provided by r. 62 of Industrial Disputes Central Rules, 1957, allowing application in Form K-3.

holdings.text: Art. 137 of the Limitation Act, 1963 does not apply to applications under s. 33C(2) of the Industrial Disputes Act
Applications under s. 33C(2) are proper where workman entitled to benefit capable of being computed in terms of money; procedure governed by r. 62 Industrial Disputes Central Rules

precedents_cited.case_name: Town Municipal Council, Athani v. The Presiding Officer, Labour Court, Hubli
precedents_cited.relevance: Art. 137 Limitation Act 1963 does not apply to s. 33C(2) applications

precedents_cited.case_name: Bombay Gas Co. Ltd. v. Gopal Bhiva and Others
precedents_cited.relevance: Interpretation of art. 181 of Limitation Act 1908 applies to art. 137 of 1963 Act

precedents_cited.case_name: The Manager M/s. P. K. Porwal v. The Labour Court
precedents_cited.relevance: Bombay High Court held art. 137 applies to s. 33C(2) applications; dissented from

statutes_cited.name: Industrial Disputes Act, 1947
statutes_cited.relevance: Governs applications for recovery of money due or computation of benefits; s.33C(2) applies here

statutes_cited.name: Limitation Act, 1963
statutes_cited.relevance: Does not apply to Labour Court applications under s.33C(2)

statutes_cited.name: Code of Civil Procedure, 1908
statutes_cited.relevance: Art. 137 applies to applications under laws contained in CPC

statutes_cited.name: Industrial Disputes (Central) Rules, 1957
statutes_cited.relevance: Provides for application in Form K-3 to specified Labour Court for determination under s.33C(2)

outcome.summary: Appeals allowed; order of Labour Court set aside insofar as it held applications barred by art. 137 Limitation Act. Labour Court directed to pass final order in accordance with law.
outcome.relief_granted: Labour Court to proceed with applications without applying limitation under art. 137
outcome.costs: Appellants entitled to costs, one hearing fee

key_quotes.text: art. 137 only contemplates applications to Courts. ... the Labour Court is not a court within the Indian Limitation Act, 1963.
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Core holding on applicability of limitation

key_quotes.text: This case falls squarely within sub-s. (2) of S. 33C.
key_quotes.speaker: court
